Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of grazing goats (head and antler of one goat and hind leg of second goat remaining) to right; part of pendant roundel, dotted cross, rising triangle, and rosette as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7).
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 33, no. 16, pl. XVII)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 72, p. 241, no. 220, pl. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0242) (phase 2)
